item.title: GNU Make, you known it, now use it !
item.description: Here is a scenario that you have probably already experienced: you intervene on a new project and your first reflex is to read the README file to understand what is going on, then starting your development. You begin to realize that this README is no longer very up-to-date and that some versions have changed. You advance by trial and error then give up by asking for help from another developer to finish your installation.

item.title: WSL + X Server + i3 : The good way to develop on Windows.
item.description: During my university years, I searched a good way to work as a developper when I’m forced to work on Windows. At the very beginning, I started the web developpment with WampServer and upgraded to WSL2 with a Ubuntu distribution. However, I was not really satisfied as my work environnment was not fully on GNU/Linux. As a web developper, I always found out that working on a different OS than the deployment server was very silly.
